title: Jewel: ‘I was sexually harassed from age 8’ | DailyTelegraph
text:
SINGER Jewel has opened up about how she was forced to defuse sexual harassment from the age of eight and refused to sleep her way to the top.
The 41-year-old is releasing her 12th studio album, Picking up the Pieces , 20 years after the release of her debut hit Pieces of You , one of the highest selling albums of all time going 15 times platinum.
Jewel - You Were Meant For Me The songwriter and poet has told The Hollywood Reporter about how the music business is dominated by males and that she has had to endure her fair share of sexual harassment.

At 8, I had men putting dimes in my hands saying, ‘Call me. It’d be so great to f*** when you’re older.’ And just horrible stuff,” she said. “In the music business, it ended up serving me very well. I learned to keep my energy to myself, where there’s nothing about me that seemed approachable. And as men did approach me, I got very good at handling men in a way that sort of didn’t anger them. ... And at the same time using wit and usually humour to defuse the situation and to inform them, ‘P.S. Not available that way.’ “
Not that kinda girl ... Jewel says she never slept her way to the top. Picture: Supplied Hit debut ... Pieces of You is one of the best-selling albums of all time. Picture: Supplied Jewel says she was singing in bars and coffee shops in San Diego when she was fired for refusing to have sex with her boss.
“I’ve never been more propositioned by businessmen in my life. It was almost like they were sharks that could smell blood, like of vulnerability,” says Jewel. “I’d go back to my car, writing songs, and men would literally come up and proposition me. They would be like, ‘Hey, do you need rent money?’ you know and things like that. It was pretty wild. I never took anybody up on it, but it was interesting to see this side of men that basically would prey on somebody vulnerable.”
Still singing ... Jewel has released her 12th studio album. Picture: Supplied Mama Jewel ... Jewel and her son Kase in 2011. Picture: Supplied Jewel touches on these issues in her raw new memoir, Never Broken: Songs Are Only Half the Story , which will be released on Sept. 15.
The singer, originally from Alaska, married rodeo cowboy Ty Murray in 2008 and they went on to have a son, Kase Murray in 2011. However the pair announced their divorce in 2014 after six years of marriage.
Originally published as ‘I was sexually harassed from age 8’
